channel.title: Benetech Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [IDEA-151] Poverty Stoplight app with office and data mgmt
item.description: An Android tablet questionnaire to be completed by microcredit clients (or other poor people) to assess their own dimensions of poverty. Helps groups focus on the specific poverty issues rather than generic (raising income does not fix all aspects of poverty). Visual questionnaire with some workflow capability.
item.summary: Poverty Stoplight app with office and data mgmt

comments.comment: Promoting to idea because it has evolved out of the secure app framework
Pipeline action Move into Exploratory executed on 11/22/2016 12:24:52 AM by John Higgins
Pipeline action Move into Early Stage executed on 12/3/2016 9:12:57 AM by Anh Bui

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Funded by Skoll: $130K as of Dec. 1 2016. Working on ODK 2.0 prototype with Sol Develo team.

item.title: [IDEA-132] Poet Image Description Training Module
item.description: expand our current training platform to provide more guidelines and interactive tools for content authors looking to make diagrams/images accessible.

item.title: [IDEA-127] Automated descriptions for images
item.description: automated extraction of key information from diagrams and images

item.title: [IDEA-113] EPUB Accessibility Certification/Checker
item.description:
facilitate review of how EPUB3 files match up against accessibility best practices. This is critical if we are to build out a Benetech certification program, but very specific to EPUB files.

can maybe leverage some of the Poet File Checker (https://diagram.herokuapp.com/image_book/image_check) that we had previously developed.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Exploratory executed on 5/13/2016 3:31:42 PM by Anh Bui

item.title: [IDEA-40] Interactive system for legal advice
item.description: provides information, notification, reminders and provide step by step guidance through complex legal situations such as immigration hearings, asylum hearings, application processes. SMS with natural language and multi-language capalities.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Exploratory executed on 5/13/2016 3:15:33 PM by Anh Bui

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Leah Werchick discussed with contact at ACLU who introduced us to International Rescue Committee VP. She thought idea was sound and will connect with her colleagues in immigration. Continuing exploration.
Connect with Center for Gender and Race Studies at UC Hastings (via Jennifer Kane).

item.title: [IDEA-32] Video management and processing for human rights
item.description:
Video management and processing system with these components:
Create a central repo for the collection, processing, and search of timecoded tags for videos. This repo can aggregate tags generated by machines or humans and can help searchers connect to the organization holding the source video. Animated word clouds of the timecoded labels can also be generated.

A human rights organization can upload a bowdlerized video or video frames which can be distributed on an online platform for geoidentification. Similar to GeoGuesser, the crowd will pick the estimated location from a map and the aggregate/average location will by offered to the original uploader"

Platform that allows human rights organizations to add descriptive metadata and tags to their media and submit that data to a searchable repository. In this manner organizations can share details amongst partners without exposing the source media. A human rights organization can upload a bowdlerized video or video frames which can be distributed on an online platform for geoidentification. Similar to GeoGuesser, the crowd will pick the estimated location from a map and the aggregate/average location will by offered to the original uploader
item.summary: Video management and processing for human rights

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Discussed with HURIDOCS as potential project for community code initiative.

item.title: [IDEA-31] Alternate Reality Game (ARG) for security training
item.description: Simulated platform where a user or organization can opt-in for training. Over the course of the game, the user will be contacted over various mediums by a simulated peer. In order to get the next piece of information, the user needs to set up various secure communications protocols. Upon successful completion of the game, the user/organization has set-up all tools needed for security.
item.summary: Alternate Reality Game (ARG) for security training

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Early Stage executed on 5/13/2016 3:02:59 PM by Anh Bui
Pipeline action Move into Mid Stage executed on 11/22/2016 12:12:10 AM by John Higgins

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Funded by Google.org. Development being contracted to external team by June 1 (likely Avantica).

item.title: [IDEA-29] MathIO
item.description: End to end math equation authoring and reading system. Creating and manipulating digital equations is difficult and often information is discarded in the publishing process. Useful for all who use online learning environments, but especially helpful for students with disabilities.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Early Stage executed on 11/23/2016 8:03:21 PM by Anh Bui. Moved due to funding from Intervalien for authoring.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Creating matrix of gaps in digital math learning + competitive analysis. Conversations with partners. Possible NSF funding. Next opportunity may be math research convening by Derrick Smith through NSF, capacity building NSF grant.

item.title: [IDEA-27] Help activists to fill out strict reporting forms
item.description: From David B. , Design an easy to use interface into which activists can enter sections of relevant data. The tool will then format, render, and submit the report in the correct/required method to comply with standards. This could be useful for things like UN Universal Periodic Review report.
item.summary: Help activists to fill out strict reporting forms

comments.comment: USAID, FHI360 interested based on conversations with Betsy in May 2016.
Pipeline action Move into Early Stage executed on 8/24/2016 8:49:26 PM by Anh Bui. Moved based on active development activity.
Current mockup: https://benetech.box.com/s/8g7ppiweqq23ma69yvmwxt94o6dnhir3

item.title: [IDEA-26] In Plain Sight Markov Chain Driven Encryption
item.description: Utilizing markov-chain logic and an agreed upon body of literature + passphrase to encrypt text into human readable text. Ex) The phrase 'meet me at eight' when run through Shakespeare encryption may read 'Whether it is far nobler to be or not to be'. This text can be posted as plain text to any technology platform (or physical medium) and network filtering/monitoring wouldn't know to be suspect of it.
item.summary: In Plain Sight Markov Chain Driven Encryption

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Early Stage executed on 6/14/2016 3:52:01 PM by Anh Bui
Pipeline action Move into Mid Stage executed on 11/22/2016 12:11:33 AM by John Higgins

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Prototype funded by Google.org. Nominated for Googleserve 2016.

item.title: [IDEA-22] Service Referral Tools and Info Management
item.description:
Social services referral decision tree 
Social services referral app for victims of violence and abuse
App for crowd-sourcing keeping social service referral data up to date
item.summary: Service Referral Tools and Info Management

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Being piloted by OpenReferral.org and DC Public Library
Requested by Safe Horizons. Similar general interest from Nancy Lublin and TextHelpLIne. Alejandra Vila offered to connect us to United Way and has some experience with value of word-of-mouth referrals.
Openreferral.org is foundation for sharing data. They are looking for funding. Could we help?

item.title: [IDEA-21] Math Support Finder
item.description: user-facing webapp to help users figure out setup configurations, along with additional technologies, required on their device to support accessible reading of content containing MathML.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Mid Stage executed on 5/18/2016 9:48:39 AM by John Higgins

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Early stage - prototype developed with Sina Bahram. Basic database in place, but need to build up community to help support expansion and maitenance of core data. Meets GL 2016 objective.

item.title: [IDEA-20] authentIcon
item.description: Authentication of crypto keys using icons rather than numbers. Unique icon represents number string. Allows same level of security with greater ease.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Mid Stage executed on 11/22/2016 12:15:04 AM by John Higgins

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Funded by Knight for $35K. Prototype has been built by volunteers at CHI4Good via Code Alliance.

item.title: [IDEA-19] Accessible Image Repository/Registry
item.description: Resource for those using and making accessible content to find and share accessible digital images in a variety of modalities, including tactile files, audio files, 3D printer files, text description.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Early Stage executed on 5/13/2016 3:09:04 PM by Anh Bui
Pipeline action Move into Mid Stage executed on 11/22/2016 5:19:14 PM by Sue-Ann Ma

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Initial design completed and circulated for feedback. Sina Bahram contracted to begin architecture work on prototype in May 2016. Legal work continuing but has been on hiatus until new General Counsel is on board.

item.title: [IDEA-18] 3D Printing for Health Education
item.description: Use 3D printing to meet needs of students requiring 3d models for health/reproductive education (e.g., students who are blind or have other disabilities). Kids with visual impairments have trouble accessing pictures and video. Although image descriptions and captioning help, hands on exploration of objects is the ideal way to learn especially in sex education. Researchers at Northern Illinois University have been focused on this issue for some time but think that 3D models will address the gap picture representation and very expensive anatomical models. NIU can consult on what TVIs need to educate blind kids around sex ed but they do not have the resources to design, distribute or store these models in a repository. Additionally this work could be used in developing countries. Lots to explore.

comments.comment: Is this still @ the right stage?

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Funded by FJC Revolving Fund to pilot. Survey has been conducted but pilot not yet underway. Should wait on securing large scale funding until we've had a chance to test the model. Volunteers needed to help create models. See Lisa Wadors.

item.title: [IDEA-17] 3D Printing for Accessible Education
item.description: Tools for making 3D printing more useful and easier for teachers and students looking to make and use accessible educational objects. Including a teacher-friendly repository of customizable learning objects, linkages to ebooks, metadata, trainings and design/print services.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move Back to Exploratory executed on 5/27/2016 2:53:51 PM by Anh Bui
Pipeline action Move into Early Stage executed on 9/28/2016 7:16:52 PM by Sue-Ann Ma

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Repository is part of Image repository idea. Lowered funding priority until pilot on health ed gives us more data.

item.title: [IDEA-16] SecureApp
item.description: A tool based on Benetech's Martus technology to allow users involved in data collection efforts to create their own write-only, open source data collection applications with end-to-end encryption, under their own branding, "Powered by Martus." The goal is to address the general need for secure data collection apps, with a solid backend for collecting, analyzing and reporting on the data.

comments.comment: Pipeline action Move into Late Stage executed on 11/22/2016 12:13:27 AM by John Higgins

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Available for internal testing: https://benetech.app.box.com/files/0/f/4572498850/Alpha_Testing_Materials

Continue pushing for beta testers.

item.title: [IDEA-15] MathML Cloud
item.description: A cloud-based app that automatically creates accurate images and image descriptions of mathematical expressions, while retaining the detailed math markup for reference. It allows content developers to accurately express digitized math and render it through visual display and alternative access means, such as synthetic speech and braille.

comments.comment:
Pipeline action Move into Late Stage executed on 11/22/2016 5:22:16 PM by Sue-Ann Ma
AWS migration complete, but introduced new bugs. Deploying partner survey in anticipation of migrating this to a community-managed open source tool (removing Benetech-hosted instance).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Adopted by O'Reilly. Funded by DIAGRAM + to add Nemeth support. Stabilize and assess for graduation. May be repackaged as part of Born Accessible Certification (IDEA-113).

item.title: [IDEA-14] Code Alliance
item.description: A program to link highly skilled technical volunteers with nonprofits that develop open source software for social impact.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Deployed; funded by Hewlett and corporate contracts. Set refined strategic direction for SC4G, teaching corporations how to better engage their hi tech volunteers for impact, and teaching non profits how to be better prepared for volunteers. Candidate for revolving fund investment?

Invest in push for corporate partners with brand and strategic refresh.
